text: James Townsend (born 20 June 1937) is a former Irish Labour Party politician and senator. Townsend stood for the Labour Party in Carlow–Kilkenny at the 1981 Irish general election, but he took only 2% of the first preference votes, and was not elected. In 1991, he was elected to Carlow County Council, representing the Muine Bheag area. He was appointed to the Seanad Éireann in 1993, serving one term, but was unsuccessful in Carlow–Kilkenny again at the 1997, 2002 and 2007 elections. At the local level, Townsend served on Carlow Town Council, and was Cathaoirleach of the county council. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Labour Party (Ireland) senators Category:Local councillors in County Carlow Category:Members of the 20th Seanad Category:Politicians from County Carlow Category:Nominated members of Seanad Éireann
title: Jim Townsend (Irish politician)
